history.content:
Funny you mention the DFT, because this is the one and only thing that 170 and 16B overlap on. 

But regarding your original question, I would say that you definitely know enough linear algebra, but your problem is that you're not strong enough at manipulating matrices. 189 deals with "intuitive linear algebra" and is all about orthogonality and projections. I say it's even heresy to call the stuff you do in 189 linear algebra because you're working with matrices not as representations of linear transformations over vector spaces (which is the real linear algebra perspective), but rather wrangling them to look for patterns in data. 

EE16B and EE 127 help build matrix-wrangling skills, which is probably what you need to develop the most (you need 16B before 127). You probably need to push 189 a semester. This shouldn't be a problem though, since you'll be a declared senior in fall 2020 so you'll have first pick of classes. 189 also isn't really important in industry if you don't specifically want to be a ML engineer. It's a good class to take before you graduate, but not crucial to your career development.

I would suggest:

Fall 2019: EE 16B, Math 113 (I wouldn't take this lightly because 16B is notoriously rough. I found it like 2.5x the commitment of 16A.)

Spring 2020: EE 127, CS 170
Fall 2020: CS 189

Spring 2020: EE 127, CS 170

Spring 2020:

I am rising junior in applied math and ls cs major and will definitely take Math 113 in fall 2019. I plan to take cs 189 in spring 2020 and do an internship in summer 2020 (I will look for an internship in fall 2019). CS 170 + EE 16B + Math 113 is too much for me in fall 2019 and now I am considering taking one of CS 170 and EE 16B plus CS 188 and Math 113. I prefer CS 170 because I think taking it in fall 2020 is too late for looking for a job (I will definitely not take CS 170 and CS 189 together in spring 2020 because of the workload). However, I am afraid that my linear algebra is not strong enough for CS 189. I have taken math 54 (above average), EE 16A (linear algebra portion above average), and math 110 (average) but I do not know anything about DFT and I do not know how to solve some of spring 2019's EE 16B linear algebra portion homework problems. Should I take CS 170 or EE 16B? Thanks!
history.subject: CS 170 or EE 16B?
